rComments: Hands-down my favourite undergrad professor. Prof. Hill cares about his students and the course material. He always responds to student questions and comments in a considerate and thoughtful way----he makes everyone feel that their opinion is valued. The midterm and exam are difficult, but he grades fairly as long as you prepare well.

I've had home for three classes throughout my time in undergrad. He was great when I had him in first year. He was okay in my third year, but fourth year is where I lost respect for him. He went downhill, IMO.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Tough grader', 'So many papers']

rComments: As an English Major I can say there are few professors as intelligent and knowledgeable as Hill. I had him for a full year and his classes were always interesting with his approaches to the novels we read. I would take any class with Hill anytime. Only thing is you have to do the work, as is expected from any student. Do that and you will be fine.

Professor Hill is the best professor I have had all my university years. If I was not graduating this year (First time taking a class with him) I would've taken many more with him. He is hilarious, so so clear in his lectures, so sweet and makes the material so interesting. I definitely recommend taking a class with him.

I loved Collin Hill! Amazing guy and amazing lectures. I only went to his office hours at the end of the term but I wish I had gone earlier, he was extremely helpful and kind. He seems very passionate about English. He can be strict in class in regards to people talking and using phones, etc. But I always left his lectures feeling inspired.

Is a cat person and not afraid to show it. If you ask nicely he might even tell you about staying at a temple once. Personal life aside, be prepared to master the art of sarcasm throughout his lectures. You'll do well as long as you are on top of your readings - essential for group assignments and tests.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Awesome guy. Went to his office hour at the end of the year and I really wish I had went sooner. Nicest guy to talk to and he pretty much let me vent about all my frustrations. Great speaker as well. Loved his lectures. My fave course ever in all of school.

He gives excellent lectures. I enjoyed every bit of it. I wish he would teach something besides just Canadian literature in upper years. I would love to take more classes with him. I would highly recommend this course with Professor Hill.

I personally would avoid this professor and class in general (I took ENG100 too). Readings were not interesting, although he did do his best to thoroughly explain texts. Yet, lectures were borderline monotone and dragged out= easy to fall asleep. Tutorials were a waste of time. TA was confusing, I didn't know what was expected. Go for ENG100
If you want a good laugh, ask him to define 'epistemology' (HINT: it is NOT a writing technique as he will claim)
This professor is rather rude, I sat in the back row for interest's sake but quickly realized he is not a fan of students who do not take humanities

My favourite prof. so far! Tutorials were actually...fun!I found my self looking forward to his class, even though most of the works we read were dead boring he made them relevent and interesting. Going to take his Can. Lit. class this year.

Professor Hill was hilarious and so engaging! The course material was challenging, but he was extremely insightful and shared such brilliant ideas that he made the material accessible. He definitely takes his work seriously, and will make sure that everybody has a positive classroom experience! An amazing prof to have!
Excellent professor! Inspirational and hilarious. I will definitely take more of his classes in the future.

Great professor! Funny, engaging and kind all the time. Wonderful explanations of literary works, covers many topics and gives great examples from texts. Be prepared to write many essays. Tutorials are extremely helpful and grant you great understanding of texts. Go to the lectures and tutorials, or you'll find yourself behind in no time...
Amazing prof!! loved his class.! didn't skip even once!

Professor Hill is one of my favourite profs ever. He is hilarious most days and I actually learned a lot. He's very engaging, and gets to know your name if you're there all the time and ask questions/make comments. This class was great and he tells it like it is. When the material is boring, he is aware of that and tried to make it interesting 9/10
He's a fantastic professor! Wonderful sense of humor, great lectures, and he's extremely helpful. Granted, he's a tough marker, but going to talk to him about  essays beforehand always helps.

Not the easiest but amazing lectures + discussions changed the way I think. Knows everyones name. Very helpful and caring. Very orgranized. Great books. Marking fair and returned fast. So helpful by email. Very funny but jokes go over some peoples heads. Really smart and REALLY cares about students. I found myself actually wanting to go to class!
Amazing!
I agree with the last person, not the greatest personality, but he gets the job done. Go Hill!

i dunno, i guess if you like his type of personality then you'll like him, but i actually did quite well in the course and found him to have a bit of a stick up his butt. not the worst prof i've had, but certainly far from the best. just so-so.
So great!
Very smart and interesting and funny.
No Comments
pretentiousness masked by concern and nicety.
His novel selection is fabulous, his lectures are facinating. He is a VERY TOUGH marker and quite intimidating to speak to because he expects everyone to be at his level of genius.
No Comments

A very nit-picky, articulate marker, but his suggestions are incerdibly helpful. He's incredibly interesting, has a wonderful sense of humour, and you get the feeling that he was once a hippy. Likes Bob Dylan, and believes in fairies and nature. :) Loved him.

I took this course because i had to for commerce, and was a little worried when i started it, but Hill is an amazing prof.  he was willing to help with essays the whole way though, and is hilarious. also, great book selection. i think i want to take more courses with him just cause he was that great
Just great
Professor Hill used to be at McGill. We miss him and we love him. He changed our lives. Who will teach us Can lit now, Colin?
good prof
Professor Hill does the impossible: he makes you love Canadian Literature. Great book selection, great lectures, and very helpful in person. I would definately take this class again!

I agree with the last person.  Proffesor Hill is so interesting and changes the way I think about Canadian lit.  He's also totally understanding if you talk to him one on one. I'm SOOO glad he came to UTM this year. I would surely take his class again.
No Comments
